runs.comm: Best's pace hurries Sibanda straight away, the ball rebounding off the hip and down to short fine leg to open Zimbabwe's account.
Best shoots one down just short of a length outside off, prompting a non-committal waft from Masakadza. Past the outside edge.
Hamilton drops a defensive stroke close to his own feet, but Sibanda is alert to the chance for a run and calls his partner through. Best hares after the ball, but he can't pick it up cleanly.
a lifting length delivery strikes Sibanda amidships, drawing a joyful whoop from the stands. Is that what the kiddies come to see?
Best's pace is just a little too hot for Sibanda at the minute. A 144.5kph thunderbolt is past his wafting leg glance in a flash to strike him on the pad. Slipping well down leg.
a good stroke for just a single. Sibanda leans over a leg-stump half volley, and this time he gets bat on ball.
stroked through the covers! Sibanda looks good on the pull, but he's perhaps even better when he drives in this fashion. Left foot to the pitch, elbow high, and the ball glides through the gap.
a touch too short, and the cut is lashed to point. Not much in the way of turn just yet.
a better delivery, straighter, and it's tapped back down the track.
punched firmly off the back foot, the ball again skidding on. Intercepted at cover.
this time he threads the gap with the cut! Sibanda waited on this one, playing it deliberately later, to find the gap behind point.
solid forward defensive ends the over - a good one for Zimbabwe, though there wasn't much rotation of the strike.
it's a different story at the other end! Best charges in and unleashes a snorter of a delivery that leaps up to strike Masakadza on the chest.
another bouncer draws a swishing pull stroke, and Best appeals - optimistically - as the ball loops through to Ramdin.
again a touch on the short side, Masakadza riding the bounce to play to leg.
again Masakadza is back in his crease, but this time his nudge to leg rolls into space and they take a single.
picked up over long leg! Best strayed in line, sending this one down the leg side, and Sibanda dispatched it to the rope with a flick off his pads. Well-hit.

but gone this time! Best digs one in outside off and Sibanda flashes hard ... only for the ball to loop straight to Simmons at third man. Sibanda was aiming to uppercut it, but couldn't get enough on it, and Simmons barely had to move. So, an early wicket for the hosts and Zimbabwe under familiar pressure.
Masakadza leans well forward to nudge a flighted delivery to midwicket.
Taylor skips down the track to get to the pitch, and dabs the ball straight to the man at midwicket.
pushed wider by the bowler, but Taylor can't find the gap with a square drive.

caught behind! Taylor attempts a reverse-sweep - or, reverse ramp shot, almost - as Badree spears one down outside off, but the ball rushes on to him and kisses the edge before it's caught by Ramdin. There's a massive appeal, and Taylor trudges off straight away.
that's a decent way to get off the mark. Ervine steps forward to crunch a low full toss through extra cover, and Zimbabwe are back up and running ... somewhat.
a better length from Badree, and Ervine steps back and across to defend.
a slower ball goes wrong, bouncing well down the leg side.
yep, there's definitely variable bounce in this track! This ball must have hit one of the bald patches, coming through slower and lower and ducking under Masakadza's bat as he backed away to leg.
again Masakadza makes room, but this time the ball comes on to the bat and he cuts to point.

muscled over deep square leg! Masakadza hasn't been at his most fluent today, but this one definitely came out of the middle. It was an attempted bouncer, but Masakadza met fire with fire to pull it away for six.
Best follows up with a sharp yorker, the ball dug out to mid on.

how has he caught that? Pollard is quite some fielder. Standing at backward point, he can't be much more than 20 metres from the bat, and this was struck ferociously hard ... and he just stretched up to pluck it out of the air one-handed. Masakadza walks off, shaking his head. He really struck this cut shot well, but he couldn't get it past Pollard's lofty frame. Zimbabwe lose another one ...
Waller thrusts forward in defense, the ball taking the inside edge of the bat to excite Best, but rolling safely to leg.
nudged gently back to the bowler.

just over a leaping Pollard at short extra cover! Ervine was aiming to leg, but the ball left him off the track and took the leading edge. Pollard backpedalled and leapt, but couldn't quite get the hands to it.
chopped down behind square, and they sprint through.
Badree spears this one down wider as Ervine makes room, and the ball scuttles through just a  little low to beat the bottom edge of his bat.

Ervine is down the track this time, but Badree spots him coming and sends this down much shorter, and quicker too. The ball grips, spinning back into Ervine and striking him high on the pad. Waller wants a single, but it's not on.
some relief for Zimbabwe! Ervine breaks the shackles with a thump through cover point off the back foot. Too wide from Badree, and it just sat up and asked to be hit.
that's not the greatest start, feeding Waller a short, wide delivery outside off that is scythed wide of the man at third man.
outside off once again, but not as wide this time and Waller runs the ball off the face of the bat in orthodox fashion.
Sammy finds a better line to the left-hander, Ervine nudging to cover point.
that's kept very low indeed! This landed on almost the same spot, perhaps just a shade fuller, but it's shot through at shin height and Ervine has to jab down in a hurry to keep it out.
a slower ball this time, but it's spotted early and played into the off side.
and another watchful push to cover ends the over.
whipped down to long on with plenty of bottom hand.
driven through the covers, slightly uppishly but in the gap.
very quick through the air, really speared in, and Waller nudges through point.
another quick, flat delivery dies off the track, taking the bottom edge of Ervine's attempted pull. It was quite short too, but never really got up.
this time Ervine goes forward rather than back, and meets the ball on the full to sweep to square leg.
a good finish to the over for Zimbabwe, Waller bending down really low to sweep powerfully out to long leg. The man out there had just been sent back, but he was too fine.
Ervine steps half forward and angles the bat to run a length delivery down behind square.
Sammy finds a troublesome length outside off, and Waller's feet can't really get moving as he prods the ball into the off side.
there's a little more authority in this stroke, Waller cutting hard out to the cover sweeper as Sammy slips just a little wide.
shot! Sammy floated this slower one up outside off, and Ervine sent it racing to the boundary with a classical, checked cover drive. Didn't over-hit it at all, just timed the shot to perfection.
past the outside edge! Sammy found that inbetween length again, and this one just left Ervine off the seam to beat the outside edge.
played with angled bat down to third man.
an offspinner to start, Ervine pushing forward to play it to the covers.
a similar delivery, but Ervine taps it off the back foot this time.
play-and-a-miss! Narine lands one in front of Ervine's off stump and zips it past his outside edge.

nudged down behind square, and Waller wants the single ... Ervine dithers, but the throw goes to the wrong end, and Waller is safely through. And there are overthrows! It was the captain, Sammy, who shied at the stumps, but his throw went wide.
and past the edge again! The turn isn't extravagant, but it's enough to beat Ervine as he plays inside the line.
the left-hander makes sure to get right behind this one to defend.
Waller rides a hint of extra bounce to pick up yet another single to third man.
Ervine walks into a defensive push, angling the bat to find the gap at gully.
a length delivery is punched through the covers for a single.
that's the right line, wicket-to-wicket, and Ervine can do little more than protect his stumps.
this time Ervine makes room, stepping away to leg, and crunches the ball past point.
thrashed out to the cover sweeper, Waller cutting off the front foot.
Narine lands one on off stump and cuts it away. Waller doesn't really have a clue, and is footed to the crease as he pokes outside off. Ball beats bat.
this time he lays bat on it, and places the ball well enough on the off side to scamper through for one.
an attempted reverse sweep from Ervine, and they race through for one as ball comes off the glove and goes wide of Sammy at slip.
Waller stays well back in his crease to read this one off the pitch, nudging to cover point.
turn and bounce! Ervine was back and hoping to cut, but the ball burst past him.

Narine ends the over with a quicker ball, and a highly optimistic appeal as Ervine is struck on the pad aiming to sweep. Umpire Nero has a good look and says no, the ball clearly landing outside leg ...
he offers Waller some width outside off, but his cut goes straight to point.
Bravo lends this one a little straight, and quite full. Waller swings merrily across the line, and takes a single as the ball rolls to fine leg.

Ervine breaks the boundary drought! Bravo's lines and lengths have been a little all over the place in this over, and this one was much too wide. Ervine leaned back and carved over point for four. That's the first boundary in 24 deliveries!
ah, a deft touch to follow up that crunching stroke. This is really well played by Ervine, who angles the bat at the last moment to run the ball through the vacant slip area.
Bravo responds with a much slower one, Ervine pushing it back down the track.
Ervine makes room, digging a full ball out through cover for a single.
just short of a good length to start, and Ervine nudges to third man.
Waller follows suit, but plays this squarer and a little uppishly, but in the gap to find a single on the off side. Good pace from Russell, up at 138.2kph.
Ervine knows exactly where his strike-rotation shot should be aimed: third man. Yet another single in that direction.
a slower ball from Russell, but Waller reads it and finds a tip-and-run single to cover point.
another slower ball, this one very slow indeed. It's nicely straight, but Ervine manages to play it into the gap at mid off.
driven down to long off for another single to end the over.
he's on the mark to start, Waller nudging defensively into the covers.
too straight, and Waller cashes in! Pollard floated this one down the leg side, and Waller helped it on it's way with a powerful pick-up to long leg.
Pollard gives Waller nothing to work with this time. A slower one, very slow at 105kph, is tapped back down the track.
again Pollard slips towards Waller's pads, the Zimbabwean slog sweeping in the air out to midwicket ... and the ball dropping well short of the fielder.
Ervine backs away and shovels a singles through cover point.

it's in the air ... and safe! Waller backs away and absolutely hacks at this one, the ball skewing off the top edge and spiraling high towards the covers. Johnson Charles sprints back, but he can't quite get to it.

stumped by miles! They got this one right on the television commentary. "Ervine came down the track, and didn't find what he was looking for." He telegraphed his intents, coming down very early, and Narine looped the ball down wider. Ervine had no choice but to go for it, but ended up wafting at thin air.
Chibhabha stays back to punch a leg-cutting delivery to point.
again Chibhabha stays back, this time punching into the covers.
he's off the mark this time, punting a full ball down to long on.
too wide from Narine, Waller is able to read it off the track and lace a cut out into the deep.
this keeps a little low, Chibhabha playing deep in his crease, but there's a good enough connection to find a single to long off.

Chibhabha didn't know too much about this run ... The ball, from Sammy, was a yorker that hit the toe and rolled to point. Chibhabha thought it had gone to leg, and took an age to respond to Waller's call for a single. Chamu motors to make his ground, diving into Sammy's legs, and fortunately for him the throw is wide.

shot! This was right in Waller's hitting arc. Pitched up outside off, and he thumped it straight back over Sammy's head for six. Waller holds the key to a competitive total. He's in, and seeing the ball reasonably well.
a slower ball is looped down the leg side. Ramdin, up to the stumps, collects as it's called wide. Waller is annoyed with himself for missing the paddle sweep.
shellacked over wide long on! Much too short at Sammy's pace. The long hop sat up, and Waller swung at it to send the ball sailing over the boundary.
another slower ball, and at just 89.6kph it takes an age to get to Waller, who drives through the covers.
a quicker ball is drilled down to long off.
another wide! These are handy extras for Zimbabwe. Once again Sammy sends this one down the leg side, even further in fact.
heaved out into the deep for another single, and Waller keeps the strike.
shot! Waller keeps the back foot rooted, but reads this one off the track to loft it over extra cover, off the back foot.

speared through much quicker by Narine, and the ball scoots through to beat Waller's sweep and hit him on the pad. There's an appeal, but the umpire isn't interested. Replays suggest that would've gone on to hit leg ...
an attempted slog sweep is toe-ended to midwicket.

lofted over extra cover! Chibhabha follows Waller's example, attacking the off side boundary as Narine offers width outside off. This was fuller, and Chibhabha played it off the front foot, but no less fluently.
the offspinner turns in sharply, but Chibhabha places it between the men behind the wicket on the off side for a single.
gone for 49! Waller makes room and swipes, the ball rushing on to rattle his stumps. It looked like the quicker offspinner, and beat the inside edge.
too hot to handle! Best starts with a searing yorker, and it's through Chibhabha before he can get the bat down. Beaten for pace, pure and simple.
not the greatest follow-up, Best hurling this one down the leg side.
again he's too quick for the batsman, but Utseya manages to get his pad in the way and kick a single to square leg.
Mutombodzi rides the bounce on this short one to work a single to square leg.

Mutombodzi should've been run out here! Utseya was beaten outside off by a slower one, and Mutombodzi spotted the chance for a single, and set off, but his partner didn't respond. Ramdin's shy went wide of the stumps, and Best wasn't backing up ...
quick, outside off, and Utseya punches to cover point. There's a misfield - which has been a rare occurrence today - and they take a single.
a slower one is swung down to long on.
deceived by the slower ball! Mutombodzi was through the shot before the ball got to him, and spooned a simple catch out to Russell at deep midwicket.
heaved to leg once again, but this time along the ground to Russell.
pushed down to long on, where Pollard is in quickly to keep them to a single.

another one perishes in the pursuit of runs! Utseya picked up a length delivery, swiping it in the air to deep midwicket. He hit it reasonably well, but was hitting into a strong wind coming from that side of the ground, so the ball plummeted down a couple of feet inside the rope, Russell again holding a simple catch.
Mushangwe aims an almighty heave towards the Antilles, but doesn't get within a foot of hitting the ball.
a boundary to end the innings! Mushangwe backs away and skews a drive over backward point. With all the protection out on the leg side, there's no-one to stop it.
